intro: Omphalodes thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's omphalodes, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. Thomson's omphalodes is typically found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
